column1: 0,Home,0.1,World,"40,80,2.35",World,Application description,"This application gives a brief overview of the cases studied in Green Growth That Works. Here is a description of the page and how to use it:

column2: The user may go through cases either by using the left and right arrows, or by selecting them in the left-hand menu.
The right-hand side panel (here) displays content specific to the case being viewed. It offers a brief summary of the case and, when available, images, figures, legends, and buttons.
The left-hand side menu is for navigation. It contains buttons to:

column3: Select and track the chapters. Each chapter contains one or multiple case studies. These will be displayed in a sub-menu once the chapter is selected. The cases with a red border contain a dynamic figure.

column2: The center displays a map of the world. The focus of the map will change according to the case being viewed. It is also possible to click on a country to explore only the cases present in that country.",,,,Book rationale,"The growth in human numbers and economic activity in the last half century has deeply transformed the planet. There have been some tremendous achievements in favor of human life and country development. However, natural capital has greatly suffered from this increased activity. Among others: loss in primary forests, destruction of ecosystems, endangerment of iconic species. In the recent years more and more voices have raised this concern. Pathways to Green Growth starts from this observation. It has the ambition of moving from ideas to action. More specifically, it aims to Mainstream Natural Capital into Policy and Finance. For this, it presents various examples of best-practice for channeling economic resource flows to conservation and restoration of natural capital. It has a rigorous and scientific approach, often using data as support. The project developed here can be thought as an interactive table of contents for Pathways to Green Growth. It locates about 20 case studies across the world. These example are all about ecosystem management (e.g Carbon market, conservation lands, water-funds etc.)."
